subject: Re: [junit] problem compiling and testing
msgSnippet: I smell copy-paste bug... ;-) There s several instances of tr1 where it seems like tr0 probably should have been used... Wayne
messageBody:
I smell copy-paste bug... ;-)

There's several instances of tr1 where it seems like tr0 probably
should have been used...

Wayne


On 2/22/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> Eric,
>
> I hate to ask, but your code includes:
>
> TestResult tr0 = new TestResult();
> TestResult tr1 = new TestResult();
> suite = new ActiveTestSuite(testClas);
> suite.runTest(suite.testAt(0), tr1); // X
> if(tr0.wasSuccessful())
>
> Did you mean tr0 at the line marked X?
>
> David Saff
>
>
> strohtennis wrote:
> > I am attempting to make a server for a computer bowl competition that
> > will test competitors source code, keep track of team results and
> > return results to the competitors. The only trouble I am having is
> > that I am getting strange results from my tests. As you can see I've
> > set up a very simple class A1 to test my results. The ActiveTestSuite
> > always returns true for both TestResults and the TestSuite returns
> > false for both.
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Eric
